page.title: 06The Honiton Show
page.content: Honiton Show is the country's biggest one-day show and takes place on the first Thursday in August on the Showground at the east end of the town, attracting 20,000 visitors. Competitors show: Horses, Sheep, Cattle, Hounds, Goats, Rabbits, Vegetables and Flowers. There is a national gymkhana and 250 trade stands exhibiting goods from all over the West Country. This year for the first time outside Exeter the BBC Radio Devon Live Theatre is appearing. The attractions include dancing horses, Honiton Royal Britsh Legion Band and a mock sea battle by South West Sea Cadets dressed in Victorian uniforms. For the first time the show has a woman president, Dame Elizabeth Butler_Sloss, High Court Judge.
